name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Interpreting Film Through Painting
base_name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Interpreting Film Through Painting
long_desc: This course is meant to introduce students to painting in a fun and less traditional way. Throughout the course, students will paint their interpretations of the themes in different movies. The course is meant to help students, even those who do not consider themselves as artistic, to learn the basic techniques of painting and to apply them to fun subject material. Through their art, students will also learn to interpret thematic motif elements in films and add their own perspective to it in their art. COURSE FEE 20.  There is a 20 course fee to provide for materials painting paper, paints, and canvas for the projects.

custom_fields.goals: They will be able to paint well even if they did not think they could paintbe artistic originally. They will consider more art classes in the future and learn how fun it can be.
custom_fields.key_topics: We will cover some fun and easy to learn painting methods for beginners, as well as thematic elements of films.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: There will be a midterm and final project that will be presented to the class. The grade is more based on how they present it to the class and is not based on innate artistic ability.
custom_fields.relevance: The course will help students engage with their creative skills and help them increase their artistic skills which can be helpful in any area of their life.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Time to complete projects outside of class.
